passage:
(1) Entrepreneurs play a crucial role in driving economic growth through innovation and job creation. These individuals identify opportunities in the market and take risks to develop new products or services that meet consumer needs. By starting and expanding businesses, entrepreneurs contribute significantly to economic development in both developed and developing countries.

(2) One of the primary ways entrepreneurs stimulate economic growth is through innovation. They introduce new technologies, processes, and business models that can increase productivity and efficiency. For example, the rise of digital platforms has transformed traditional industries and created entirely new markets. These innovations often lead to increased competition, which encourages existing businesses to improve their offerings, resulting in better products and services for consumers.

(3) Entrepreneurs also make substantial contributions to job creation. New businesses require workers, and as these ventures grow, they hire more employees. Research shows that startups and young businesses generate a disproportionate share of new jobs compared to established firms. This job creation is particularly important during economic downturns when larger companies might be reducing their workforce to cut costs.

(4) Additionally, entrepreneurship promotes economic diversification, which is essential for resilient economies. When entrepreneurs establish businesses in various sectors, they help countries become less dependent on a single industry. This diversification reduces vulnerability to sector-specific shocks and creates more stable economic conditions over time. Furthermore, successful entrepreneurial ventures generate tax revenue that governments can invest in infrastructure, education, and other public services.

(5) Despite these benefits, entrepreneurs often face significant challenges, including limited access to funding, regulatory hurdles, and market uncertainties. Governments and organizations that recognize the importance of entrepreneurship frequently develop policies and programs to support new business creation. These might include simplified registration processes, tax incentives, business incubators, and financing options specifically designed for startups. By fostering environments where entrepreneurship can flourish, countries can better position themselves for sustained economic growth and prosperity.

questions.question: Which sentence contains the correct verb form?

options.A: She have been studying English for five years.
options.B: They has traveled to many countries.
options.C: He doesn't likes coffee in the morning.
options.D: We were watching a movie when the power went out.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition to complete the sentence: The book is _____ the table.

options.A: in
options.B: on
options.C: at

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct conditional form:

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him the news.
options.B: If I had known earlier, I will come to help you.
options.C: If it rains tomorrow, we'll cancel the picnic.
options.D: If I am rich, I would buy a big house.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the past perfect tense correctly?

options.A: I have finished my homework before dinner.
options.B: She had already left when I arrived.
options.C: They have been working here since last year.
options.D: We was studying when you called.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct article usage:

options.A: I saw a interesting movie last night.
options.B: She is the best student in an entire school.
options.C: He bought a new car last month.
options.D: We visited the university in United States.

questions.question: Select the correctly punctuated sentence:

options.A: After we finished shopping we went to a restaurant.
options.B: After we finished shopping, we went to a restaurant.
options.C: After, we finished shopping we went to a restaurant.
options.D: After we finished, shopping we went to a restaurant.

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates correct subject-verb agreement?

options.A: The team are playing well this season.
options.B: The number of students in the class have increased.
options.C: Everyone in the office need to attend the meeting.
options.D: Neither of the candidates has withdrawn from the race.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct comparative form:

options.A: This exercise is more easier than the previous one.
options.B: My brother is taller than me.
options.C: She is the most happiest person I know.
options.D: This is the more interesting book I've ever read.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with proper modal verb usage:

options.A: You must to arrive before 9 o'clock.
options.B: Children should to respect their elders.
options.C: She can play the piano very well.
options.D: We will can visit you next weekend.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a correctly formed passive voice?

options.A: The cake was ate by the children.
options.B: The letter written by my friend last week.
options.C: The window was broken by a baseball.
options.D: The car is fixing by the mechanic.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of reported speech:

options.A: She said that she will come tomorrow.
options.B: He told me that he is sick yesterday.
options.C: They said they had finished the project the day before.
options.D: The teacher said that the Earth is flat.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the proper use of relative pronouns:

options.A: The man which lives next door is a doctor.
options.B: The book who I bought yesterday is interesting.
options.C: The woman whose car was stolen called the police.
options.D: The house where I grew up it is no longer there.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with correct future tense usage:

options.A: I am going to visiting my grandparents next week.
options.B: She will finishing the report by tomorrow.
options.C: They are going to move to a new house next month.
options.D: We will be travel to Spain in the summer.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct gerund or infinitive use:

options.A: She enjoys to swim in the ocean.
options.B: I look forward to see you soon.
options.C: They decided buying a new car.
options.D: He promised to help us move next weekend.

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates correct use of quantifiers?

options.A: There are few people who can speak three languages.
options.B: She doesn't have many time to finish the project.
options.C: How much students are in your class?
options.D: I don't have much friends in this city.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: The customer was unhappy with the service and asked to speak _____ the manager.

options.A: for
options.B: with
options.C: to

options.A: most
options.B: best
options.C: better

options.A: lost
options.B: has lost
options.C: was losing

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb to complete the sentence: We need to _____ a date for our next meeting.

options.C: take over

options.B: slept with the fishes
options.C: slept on it

questions.question: Choose the correct collocation: She always _____ a lot of attention to detail in her work.

options.A: makes
options.B: takes
options.C: pays

questions.question: Select the most appropriate linker to complete the sentence: He worked very hard; _____, he failed the exam.

options.A: therefore
options.B: however
options.C: furthermore

questions.question: Choose the best way to complete the sentence: If you want to improve your English, you need to practice _____.

options.A: on regular basis
options.B: in regular basis
options.C: on a regular basis

questions.question: Select the correct option to complete the sentence: I'd rather _____ to the party than stay at home.

options.A: to go
options.B: going
options.C: go

questions.question: Choose the correct option to make this polite request: _____ opening the window, please?

options.A: Would you mind
options.B: Do you mind
options.C: Could you mind

options.A: To carefully examine something

options.C: To ask for permission

options.A: A formal speech given to an audience
options.B: A casual conversation
options.C: A serious discussion

options.A: I approach my keys on the table.
options.B: The teacher has an interesting approach to teaching mathematics.
options.C: We approach the milk in the refrigerator.

options.A: Above
options.B: Underneath
options.C: Beside

options.A: I'll remember to call you tomorrow.
options.B: She remembered the book on the shelf.
options.C: They remember the party next week.
options.D: He is remembering his wallet at home.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the word 'force' correctly?

options.A: The wind force was open the window.
options.B: She forced to eat vegetables as a child.
options.C: The police used force to enter the building.
options.D: I will force arriving on time.

questions.question: Select the sentence where 'arrange' is used appropriately:

options.A: She arranged the flowers in a vase.
options.B: They arrange at the airport yesterday.
options.C: He arranges the music very loudly.
options.D: I will arrange to the cinema tomorrow.

questions.question: Which definition best describes the word 'attack'?

options.A: To defend oneself from danger
options.B: To act in a violent way toward someone or something
options.C: To retreat from a difficult situation

options.A: We need to buy some paint for the walls.

options.C: She painted a beautiful landscape.

questions.question: What does 'announce' mean?

options.A: To hide information from others
options.B: To make something known publicly
options.C: To misunderstand a message

questions.question: Choose the sentence where 'carry' is used correctly:

options.A: She carried a secret for many years.
options.B: He carries the ball into the goal.
options.C: They carried to school by bus.
options.D: I will carry swimming next week.

options.A: Please drink enough water every day.
options.B: Would you like a cold drink?
options.C: The plants need to drink water.

options.A: A flat surface
options.B: A tool used for measuring
options.C: A degree of skill or achievement

questions.question: Choose the sentence that uses 'apply' correctly:

options.A: You need to apply pressure to stop the bleeding.
options.B: She applied the book to the shelf.
options.C: They applied very happy about the news.
options.D: I will apply my dog for a walk.

questions.question: Select the sentence where 'sell' is used correctly:

options.A: He sells a lot of books last month.
options.B: They sell arriving tomorrow.
options.C: She is selling her old car next week.
options.D: I sold very tired after work.

questions.question: According to paragraph 1, entrepreneurs contribute to economic growth by:

options.A: Reducing competition in markets
options.B: Taking government subsidies
options.C: Identifying opportunities and developing new products

questions.question: What does the passage suggest is a primary way entrepreneurs stimulate economic growth?

options.A: By providing tax revenue
options.B: Through innovation
options.C: By investing in infrastructure

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, which statement is true about job creation?

options.A: Established firms create more jobs than startups.
options.B: New businesses hire fewer workers as they grow.
options.C: Startups generate a disproportionate share of new jobs.
options.D: Job creation is not important during economic downturns.

questions.question: What does the passage identify as essential for resilient economies?

options.A: Dependence on a single industry
options.B: Economic diversification
options.C: Reduced entrepreneurship

questions.question: According to paragraph 4, how does entrepreneurship help countries become more economically stable?

options.A: By concentrating resources in one sector
options.B: By reducing the number of businesses
options.C: By making countries less dependent on a single industry

questions.question: What challenges do entrepreneurs face according to the passage?

options.A: Too much government support
options.B: Excessive funding options
options.C: Limited access to funding and regulatory hurdles

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way governments support entrepreneurship?

options.A: Tax incentives
options.B: Simplified registration processes
options.C: Direct management of startups

questions.question: The passage suggests that increased competition resulting from entrepreneurial innovation leads to:

options.A: Higher prices for consumers
options.B: Reduced product quality
options.C: Better products and services

questions.question: According to the passage, what can governments invest in using tax revenue generated by successful entrepreneurial ventures?

options.A: Military expansion
options.B: Infrastructure and education
options.C: Foreign aid programs

questions.question: What is the main purpose of this passage?

options.A: To criticize government policies regarding entrepreneurship
options.B: To explain how consumers benefit from entrepreneurship
options.C: To describe the challenges entrepreneurs face without offering solutions
options.D: To explain how entrepreneurs contribute to economic growth and development
